meanings.definition: Chosen by election; appointed or selected by vote.
meanings.sent1: The student council held an elective meeting to decide on the new class president.
meanings.sent2: The elective committee was responsible for choosing the best candidate for the position.
meanings.sent3: It was an elective process to determine the winner of the school talent show.
meanings.sent4: The elective nature of the decision-making made everyone feel included.
meanings.sent5: The elective system ensured fairness in the selection of the team captain.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the power of choosing; selecting.
meanings.sent1: Her elective ability to make decisions quickly impressed her colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The manager's elective skills in problem-solving were highly valued in the company.
meanings.sent3: His elective knack for picking the right investments saved the company from losses.
meanings.sent4: The team leader's elective approach to delegating tasks improved efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The professor's elective guidance helped the students excel in their projects.

meanings.definition: An optional course or subject in a school or college curriculum.
meanings.sent1: I decided to take an elective in art history to broaden my knowledge.
meanings.sent2: The school offers a variety of electives such as music, drama, and computer science.
meanings.sent3: Choosing an elective in astronomy opened up a whole new world of learning for me.
meanings.sent4: The elective on environmental studies sparked my interest in conservation efforts.
meanings.sent5: The elective course on photography allowed me to explore my creative side.
